alert.note: Alert for Park; Sweet Grass (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 2:45AM MDT until June 14 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Billings MT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River near Livingston affecting Park and Sweet Grass Counties. Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone at Edgar affecting Carbon County. Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone near Belfry affecting Carbon County. .Rapid snowmelt across area mountains has resulted in rapid rises on these rivers. In addition to the snowmelt, heavy rainfall may further increase water levels over the next few days. At this time expect rivers to rise above flood stage Monday. Colder temperatures in the high country will slow snowmelt by Tuesday allowing river levels to recede into the middle of the week. In addition to minor flooding of low lying areas along the rivers, significant erosion is likely. For the Yellowstone River...including Livingston...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone...including Belfry, Edgar... Minor flooding is forecast. * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellowstone River near Livingston. * WHEN...From early this morning to Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Roads to mill creek, cinnebar basin and trail creek are covered with water. Water will also be over portions of yellowstone park road for 800 yards, 3.5 miles south of town, including a few farm homes. Flooding over the road to 9th street island with water reaching some homes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 10.2 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.2 feet on 06/01/2020. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Yellowstone River Livingston 10.0 8.4 Sun 1 am 9.7 9.8 8.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Undercut banks can collapse and you will find yourself in a deadly situation in fast moving cold water. Stay away from river banks until the river recedes to normal summer flows, especially children. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. Safety message...A river Flood Warning means river flooding is expected to impact people and property in the warned area. Prepare for flooding impacts associated with the forecast river levels in your location. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Monday morning at 715 AM MDT.
